page.title: 16HISTORICAL FACTS
page.content: The area is steeped in history. The name Salford derived from the Saxon Sealhford, meaning Willowford, became Saleford and eventually Salford. It is interesting to note that mention of an owner of the Manor of Salford was Nigel de Salford a l2th century benefactor. A water mill is known to have been at Salford in 1086 . A disused water mill remains on the same site which fell into disuse in the early 1960's. A school at Salford, built in l867 which closed in 1952 is now part of the Village Hall. The villages of Hulcote and Salford benefit from three Charities, which are now jointly administered. The Woodward Charity provides for a payment of Â£5 to school leavers. The Hervey Charity aids the poor and the Town Sands Charity which is under Church management.
